context: To Kill a Mockingbird is a novel by <a2_0><a3_0>Harper Lee<a3_0/><a2_0/> published in <a0_0><a4_0>1960<a4_0/><a0_0/>. It was immediately successful, winning the <a1_0>Pulitzer Prize<a1_0/>, and has become a classic of modern American literature. The plot and characters are loosely based on the author's observations of <a5_0>her family and neighbors<a5_0/>, as well as on an event that occurred near her hometown in 1936, when she was 10 years old.
